website_summaries.verdict: The durable yet reasonably priced Salewa Crow GTX mountaineering boot was able to render satisfying support, fit and traction to its users. Its virtually no break-in period was admired and liked by consumers. It lived up to the brand’s promise of 100% blister free experience. The boot’s Gore-Tex lining also received praise from an expert. What left some wearers upset was its insuficient breathability.
pros: Expert reviewers mentioned that the Crow GTX from Salewa is a good value for the money
One of them noted that the affordable price of this mountaineering boot exceeded his expectations
Some wearers were satisfied with the support they got from the pair
The traction of the Salewa Crow GTX was impressive, according to a considerable number of users
Several consumers liked the fit of this Salewa boot
They said that it hugged their foot perfectly
The virtually no break-in period of this pair delighted a few
The boot was able to deliver on its 100% blister-free guarantee
A pleased expert reviewer liked the Gore-Tex lining of the pair
He mentioned that it was beneficial in traversing snowy conditions
The membrane was also able to provide warmth
This Salewa footwear was commended by a YouTube gear reviewer for being outstandingly durable
cons: Its internal ventilation could be better, according to a professional footwear critic

customer_reviews.title: Great fit, grippy soles and absolutely waterproof
customer_reviews.text: Delivery from Germany to UK respecting the indicated time at the order. The boots were utilised on mixed hilly areas including a shallow river at a southern coastal area of England for around five hours of hiking covering about 17 miles. Could not be any happier - excellent results, no blister neither any discomfort and fully waterproof. came with three fitting options in the form of two additional soft rubber undersoles, one half and the other full length. Rigid soles may seem stiff at first but you will get to appreciate it if you walk on lose rock for the security it provides. Just make sure to couple them with the thickest wool socks you could find
customer_reviews.author: Sel Thad

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight comfortable 4 season boots
customer_reviews.text: Bought for winter hillwalking and ability to take a C2 crampon. They claim to guarantee no blisters. I’ve worn them just twice / a short 2 hour hike and a longer 5 hour hillwalk in mixed conditions- they performed excellently. I love the customisable insoles - a great idea. Lacing system could be better but it’s similar to most 4 season boots.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. S. Watson

customer_reviews.title: Nice boots
customer_reviews.text: Great boot nice styling ! Something a bit different from the norm. I have a pair of Nepal’s and now with these I can alternate between both depending on temp
customer_reviews.author: PM1

customer_reviews.title: Seem like really great boots
customer_reviews.text: These seem really comfortable, with a great sole and seem able to take anything. They are super stiff so great for climbing in technical terrain, and crampon compatible. I did have to return them due to a slight squeeze of the pinky toes (a problem with my weirdly wide feet so wouldn't put this down to the boot) which became worse when I tried on with thick hiking socks, and would have got the next size up but none were in stock. Will put on my watchlist
customer_reviews.author: skinnyfat

customer_reviews.title: Very good.
customer_reviews.text: Very good hiking shoes, im not sure if its just me and my brother, but after 9-10 hours of hiking i could barely feel my feet when i took them off. This shoes quite hard and were doing really good during hiking, they have slot for half automatic crampons which is good advantage.
customer_reviews.author: Bartosz Ciezki

customer_reviews.title: Comford over style
customer_reviews.text: Everyone on the girls holiday looked at me funny for wearing these in Venice for our 4 day holiday.... but who had warm and comfy feet when it was -8c? Me!the inly downside is they are a tad heavy, gives a great leg workout.
customer_reviews.author: S Fox

customer_reviews.title: Light, comfortable and robust!
customer_reviews.text: Great fit, comfortable and light. My second pair of Salewa boots after owning my previous pair for over 7 years. Great scrambling boots!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very good quality
customer_reviews.text: It is what I expected, good quality and very light.
customer_reviews.author: Cosmin Gheorghe

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality but poor fitting
customer_reviews.text: Boots are of excellent quality but the laces are too short. Very narrow fitting and lots of rubbing either side of my feet. If you have wide feet, I would suggest looking for a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: Gray Vincent

customer_reviews.title: Not blister-free! Not waterproof.
customer_reviews.text: Lovely looking boots. Their 'guarantee' to not give you blisters is rubbish though, as you can see from my wife's foot! Sadly out for only the third walk today and one of her boots has let in lots of water. AVOID!
customer_reviews.author: Mr. K. Stainsby

product_meta.title: Salewa Men's Ms Crow Gore-tex High Rise Hiking Shoes
product_meta.description: The Crow GTX is a versatile mountaineering shoe with outer material made from abrasion-resistant fabric and waterproof Gore-Tex® protection. Versatile use in summer on general alpine terrain as well as for alpine trekking tours, the Crow GTX with its crampon-compatible Vibram Shell sole - for Combi crampons - grip on rocks and grip on varied mountain rain and snow. The Gore-Tex® performance comfort lining ensures optimum climate comfort when the weather comes into contact with you, and the rubber edge strip provides all-round protection for rocks and debris. The Condor Evo GTX combines the patented SALEWA technologies and thus offers the Alpine Fit 100% bubble-free guarantee: 3F system for a secure hold in the heel and ankle area, climbing shoe lacing system for a perfect individual fit of your foot and anatomically shaped reinforcement for comfort when descending.
